arm_group.description: E-glove rehabilitation system for upper extremity

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether novel upper extremity rehabilitation
      system for patients with stroke(e-glove system) are effective in the rehabilitation compared
      to conventional occupational therapy

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Novel Game Rehabilitation System on Upper Extremity Function of Patients With Stroke

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Hemiplegic stroke patients

          -  Medical research council scale >= 2 of finger or wrist flexor/extensor

          -  Medical research council scale >= 2 of elbow pronation/supination

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Bilateral weakness of upper extremities

          -  Uncontrolled medical or surgical illness

          -  Predisposing psychological or neurological disorders

          -  Severe aphasia unable to communicate

          -  Severe cognitive impairment not to cooperate

          -  Severe pain impeding upper extremity rehabilitation

intervention.description: Novel rehabilitation system using game for upper extremity rehabilitation for patients with stroke

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Novel Game Rehabilitation System (E-glove System) on Upper Extremity Function of Patients With Stroke :Randomized Controlled Trial

authority: Korea: Ministry for Health, Welfare and Family Affairs

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline in Fugl-Meyer assessment at 4 weeks after intervention

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline in Jebsen hand function test at 4 weeks after intervention

collaborator.agency: Republic of Korea, Ministry of Trade, Industry & Energy
Republic of Korea, National IT Industry Promotion Agency

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
